intro: Argythamnia coatepensis, commonly known as the Coatepeque dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
